alert.note: Alert for Gallia; Jackson; Meigs; Vinton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Greenup, west central Meigs, Gallia, southeastern Jackson, southeastern Vinton, central Lawrence and northwestern Mason Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near South Webster, or 10 miles southwest of Oak Hill, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and hail up to half an inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Oak Hill, Rio Grande, Lake Vesuvius, Greenup, Franklin Furnace, Gallia, Vernon, Waterloo, South Shore, Henderson, Vinton, Wilkesville, Adamsville, Gallopolis Ferry, Salem Center, Gage, Grays Branch and Pedro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern Kentucky...southeastern Ohio...and western West Virginia.
